title.raw: 《世家‧吳太伯世家》 Genealogies - House of Wu Taibo

sentences.zh: 吳太伯，太伯弟仲雍，皆周太王之子，而王季歷之兄也。

translations.literal: Wu Tai Bo, Tai Bo younger brother Zhong Yong, all Zhou Tai Wang sons, and Wang Ji Li brothers also.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Taibo, and Taibo's younger brother Zhongyong, were both sons of the King Tai of Zhou, and were the older brothers of King Jili.

sentences.zh: 季歷賢，而有聖子昌，太王欲立季歷以及昌，於是太佰、仲雍二人乃奔荊蠻，文身斷發，示不可用，以避季歷。

translations.literal: Ji Li worthy, and had sage son Chang, Tai Wang wanted establish Ji Li and reach Chang, therefore Tai Bo, Zhong Yong two people then fled Jing Man, tattooed bodies cut hair, showed could not use, to avoid Ji Li.
translations.idiomatic: Jili was worthy and had a sage son, Chang. King Tai wanted to establish Jili and reach Chang, so Taibo and Zhongyong, these two men, then fled to the Jing Man, tattooed their bodies and cut their hair, showing they could not be used, in order to avoid Jili.

sentences.zh: 季歷果立，是為王季，而昌為文王。

translations.literal: Ji Li indeed established, this was Wang Ji, and Chang became Wen Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Jili was indeed established, and this was the King Ji, and Chang became King Wen.

sentences.zh: 太伯之奔荊蠻，自號句吳。

translations.literal: Tai Bo fled Jing Man, self named Gou Wu.
translations.idiomatic: When Taibo fled to the Jing Man, he named himself Gou Wu.

sentences.zh: 荊蠻義之，從而歸之千餘家，立為吳太伯。

translations.literal: Jing Man considered righteous, followed and submitted thousand more families, established as Wu Tai Bo.
translations.idiomatic: The Jing Man considered him righteous, and more than a thousand families followed and submitted to him, and they established him as Wu Taibo.

translations.literal: Wu Taibo, Taibo's younger brother Zhong Yong, both were sons of Zhou Tai Wang, and elder brothers of Wang Ji Li. Ji Li was worthy, and had a sage son Chang, Tai Wang wished to establish Ji Li and then Chang, therefore Taibo and Zhong Yong two people fled to Jing Man, tattooed their bodies and cut their hair, showing they could not be used, to avoid Ji Li. Ji Li indeed was established, this was Wang Ji, and Chang became Wen Wang. Taibo's flight to Jing Man, self-titled Gou Wu. Jing Man considered him righteous, followed and submitted to him over a thousand families, established as Wu Taibo.

sentences.zh: 太伯卒，無子，弟仲雍立，是為吳仲雍。

translations.literal: Tai Bo died, no son, younger brother Zhong Yong established, this was Wu Zhong Yong.
translations.idiomatic: Taibo died without a son, and his younger brother Zhongyong was established, and this was Wu Zhongyong.

sentences.zh: 仲雍卒，子季簡立。

translations.literal: Zhong Yong died, son Ji Jian established.
translations.idiomatic: Zhongyong died, and his son Jijian was established.

sentences.zh: 季簡卒，子叔達立。

translations.literal: Ji Jian died, son Shu Da established.
translations.idiomatic: Jijian died, and his son Shuda was established.

sentences.zh: 叔達卒，子周章立。

translations.literal: Shu Da died, son Zhou Zhang established.
translations.idiomatic: Shuda died, and his son Zhouzhang was established.

sentences.zh: 是時周武王克殷，求太伯、仲雍之後，得周章。

translations.literal: This time Zhou Wu Wang conquered Yin, sought Tai Bo, Zhong Yong descendants, got Zhou Zhang.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, King Wu of Zhou conquered Yin and sought the descendants of Taibo and Zhongyong, and found Zhouzhang.

sentences.zh: 周章已君吳，因而封之。

translations.literal: Zhou Zhang already ruled Wu, therefore sealed him.
translations.idiomatic: Zhouzhang already ruled Wu, and therefore they enfeoffed him.

sentences.zh: 乃封周章弟虞仲於周之北故夏虛，是為虞仲，列為諸侯。

translations.literal: Then sealed Zhou Zhang younger brother Yu Zhong at Zhou north former Xia capital, this was Yu Zhong, listed as feudal lord.
translations.idiomatic: Then they enfeoffed Zhouzhang's younger brother Yuzhong at the former Xia capital north of Zhou, and this was Yuzhong, listed as a feudal lord.

translations.literal: Taibo died, had no sons, younger brother Zhong Yong established, this was Wu Zhong Yong. Zhong Yong died, son Ji Jian established. Ji Jian died, son Shu Da established. Shu Da died, son Zhou Zhang established. At this time Zhou Wu Wang conquered Yin, sought Taibo and Zhong Yong's descendants, obtained Zhou Zhang. Zhou Zhang already ruled Wu, therefore enfeoffed him. Then enfeoffed Zhou Zhang's younger brother Yu Zhong at Zhou's north former Xia capital, this was Yu Zhong, ranked as feudal lord.

sentences.zh: 周章卒，子熊遂立，熊遂卒，子柯相立。

translations.literal: Zhou Zhang died, son Xiong Sui established, Xiong Sui died, son Ke Xiang established.
translations.idiomatic: When Zhouzhang died, his son Xiongsui was established on the throne. When Xiongsui died, his son Kexiang was established.

sentences.zh: 柯相卒，子彊鳩夷立。

translations.literal: Ke Xiang died, son Qiang Jiu Yi established.
translations.idiomatic: Kexiang died, and his son Qiang Jiuyi was established.

sentences.zh: 彊鳩夷卒，子餘橋疑吾立。

translations.literal: Qiang Jiu Yi died, son Yu Qiao Yi Wu established.
translations.idiomatic: Qiang Jiuyi died, and his son Yu Qiaoyiwu was established.

sentences.zh: 餘橋疑吾卒，子柯盧立。

translations.literal: Yu Qiao Yi Wu died, son Ke Lu established.
translations.idiomatic: Yu Qiaoyiwu died, and his son Kelu was established.

sentences.zh: 柯盧卒，子周繇立。

translations.literal: Ke Lu died, son Zhou You established.
translations.idiomatic: Kelu died, and his son Zhouyou was established.

sentences.zh: 周繇卒，子屈羽立。

translations.literal: Zhou You died, son Qu Yu established.
translations.idiomatic: Zhouyou died, and his son Quyu was established.

sentences.zh: 屈羽卒，子夷吾立。

translations.literal: Qu Yu died, son Yi Wu established.
translations.idiomatic: Quyu died, and his son Yiwu was established.

sentences.zh: 夷吾卒，子禽處立。

translations.literal: Yi Wu died, son Qin Chu established.
translations.idiomatic: Yiwu died, and his son Qinchu was established.

sentences.zh: 禽處卒，子轉立。

translations.literal: Qin Chu died, son Zhuan established.
translations.idiomatic: Qinchu died, and his son Zhuan was established.

sentences.zh: 轉卒，子頗高立。

translations.literal: Zhuan died, son Po Gao established.
translations.idiomatic: Zhuan died, and his son Pogao was established.

sentences.zh: 頗高卒，子句卑立。

translations.literal: Po Gao died, son Gou Bei established.
translations.idiomatic: Pogao died, and his son Goubei was established.

sentences.zh: 是時晉獻公滅周北虞公，以開晉伐虢也。

translations.literal: This time Jin Xian Gong extinguished Zhou north Yu Gong, to open Jin attack Guo also.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Duke Xian of Jin extinguished the Duke of Yu north of Zhou, in order to open the way for Jin to attack Guo.

sentences.zh: 句卑卒，子去齊立。

translations.literal: Gou Bei died, son Qu Qi established.
translations.idiomatic: Goubei died, and his son Quqi was established.

sentences.zh: 去齊卒，子壽夢立。

translations.literal: Qu Qi died, son Shou Meng established.
translations.idiomatic: Quqi died, and his son Shoumeng was established.

sentences.zh: 壽夢立而吳始益大，稱王。

translations.literal: Shou Meng established and Wu began moreover great, called king.
translations.idiomatic: When Shoumeng was established, Wu began to grow even greater and called itself king.

translations.literal: Zhou Zhang died, son Xiong Sui established, Xiong Sui died, son Ke Xiang established. Ke Xiang died, son Qiang Jiu Yi established. Qiang Jiu Yi died, son Yu Qiao Yi Wu established. Yu Qiao Yi Wu died, son Ke Lu established. Ke Lu died, son Zhou You established. Zhou You died, son Qu Yu established. Qu Yu died, son Yi Wu established. Yi Wu died, son Qin Chu established. Qin Chu died, son Zhuan established. Zhuan died, son Po Gao established. Po Gao died, son Gou Bei established. At this time Jin Xian Gong extinguished Zhou north Yu Gong, to open Jin's attack on Guo. Gou Bei died, son Qu Qi established. Qu Qi died, son Shou Meng established. Shou Meng established and Wu began increasingly great, called king.

sentences.zh: 自太伯作吳，五世而武王克殷，封其後為二：其一虞，在中國；

translations.literal: From Tai Bo made Wu, five generations and Wu Wang conquered Yin, sealed their descendants as two: its one Yu, in central states;
translations.idiomatic: From when Taibo made Wu, five generations passed and King Wu conquered Yin, and he enfeoffed their descendants as two: one was Yu, in the central states;

sentences.zh: 其一吳，在夷蠻。

translations.literal: Its one Wu, in barbarian barbarians.
translations.idiomatic: the other was Wu, among the barbarian Man.

sentences.zh: 十二世而晉滅中國之虞。

translations.literal: Twelve generations and Jin extinguished central states Yu.
translations.idiomatic: Twelve generations passed, and Jin extinguished the Yu of the central states.

sentences.zh: 中國之虞滅二世，而夷蠻之吳興。

translations.literal: Central states Yu extinguished two generations, and barbarian barbarians Wu rose.
translations.idiomatic: The Yu of the central states was extinguished after two generations, and the Wu of the barbarian Man rose.

sentences.zh: 大凡從太伯至壽夢十九世。

translations.literal: Generally from Tai Bo to Shou Meng nineteen generations.
translations.idiomatic: In general, from Taibo to Shoumeng there were nineteen generations.

translations.literal: From Taibo made Wu, five generations and Wu Wang conquered Yin, enfeoffed descendants as two: one Yu, in central states; one Wu, in barbarian Yi. Twelve generations and Jin extinguished central states Yu. Central states Yu extinguished two generations, barbarian Yi Wu rose. Generally from Taibo to Shou Meng nineteen generations.

sentences.zh: 王壽夢二年，楚之亡大夫申公巫臣怨楚將子反而奔晉，自晉使吳，教吳用兵乘車，令其子為吳行人，吳於是始通於中國。

translations.literal: King Shou Meng second year, Chu exiled grand master Shen Gong Wu Chen resented Chu general Zi Fan and fled Jin, from Jin sent to Wu, taught Wu use troops ride chariots, ordered his son become Wu envoy, Wu therefore began connected with central states.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year of King Shoumeng, Shen Gong Wuchen, a grand master who had fled from Chu, resented Chu's general Zifan and fled to Jin. From Jin, he was sent to Wu, taught Wu to use troops and ride chariots, and ordered his son to become a Wu envoy. Wu therefore began to be connected with the central states.

sentences.zh: 吳伐楚。

translations.literal: Wu attacked Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Wu attacked Chu.

sentences.zh: 十六年，楚共王伐吳，至衡山。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, Chu Gong Wang attacked Wu, reached Heng Shan.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, King Gong of Chu attacked Wu and reached Hengshan.

translations.literal: King Shou Meng second year, Chu's fugitive grand master Shen Gong Wu Xian resented Chu general Zi Fan and fled to Jin, from Jin sent to Wu, taught Wu to use troops and chariots, made his son Wu's messenger, Wu then began to communicate with central states. Wu attacked Chu. Sixteenth year, Chu Gong Wang attacked Wu, reached Heng Shan.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，王壽夢卒。

translations.literal: Twenty fifth year, King Shou Meng died.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, King Shoumeng died.

sentences.zh: 壽夢有子四人，長曰諸樊，次曰餘祭，次曰餘眛，次曰季札。

translations.literal: Shou Meng had sons four people, eldest called Zhu Fan, next Yu Ji, next Yu Mei, next Ji Zha.
translations.idiomatic: Shoumeng had four sons: the eldest was called Zhufan, the next was Yuji, the next was Yumei, and the next was Jizha.

sentences.zh: 季札賢，而壽夢欲立之，季札讓不可，於是乃立長子諸樊，攝行事當國。

translations.literal: Ji Zha worthy, and Shou Meng wanted establish him, Ji Zha declined could not, therefore then established eldest son Zhu Fan, acted as ruler managed state.
translations.idiomatic: Jizha was worthy, and Shoumeng wanted to establish him, but Jizha declined and could not be persuaded. Therefore, they then established the eldest son, Zhufan, who acted as ruler and managed the state.

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year, King Shou Meng died. Shou Meng had four sons, eldest Zhu Fan, second Yu Ji, second Yu Mei, youngest Ji Zha. Ji Zha was worthy, Shou Meng wished to establish him, Ji Zha declined could not, therefore established eldest son Zhu Fan, oversaw affairs managing state.

sentences.zh: 王諸樊元年，諸樊已除喪，讓位季札。

translations.literal: King Zhu Fan first year, Zhu Fan already completed mourning, yielded position Ji Zha.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of King Zhufan, Zhufan had already completed mourning and yielded the position to Jizha.

sentences.zh: 季札謝曰：「曹宣公之卒也，諸侯與曹人不義曹君，將立子臧，子臧去之，以成曹君，君子曰『能守節矣』。

translations.literal: Ji Zha declined said: 'Cao Xuan Gong death also, feudal lords with Cao people did not consider righteous Cao ruler, would establish Zi Zang, Zi Zang left it, to complete Cao ruler, gentlemen said 'could guard integrity'.'
translations.idiomatic: Jizha declined and said: 'When Duke Xuan of Cao died, the feudal lords and the people of Cao did not consider the Cao ruler righteous and would have established Zizang. Zizang left it, to complete the Cao ruler, and gentlemen said, 'He could guard integrity.'

sentences.zh: 君義嗣，誰敢干君！

translations.literal: Lord righteous successor, who dare disturb lord!
translations.idiomatic: You, my lord, are the righteous successor. Who would dare to disturb you, my lord!

sentences.zh: 有國，非吾節也。

translations.literal: Have state, not my integrity also.
translations.idiomatic: To have a state is not my integrity.

sentences.zh: 札雖不材，願附於子臧之義。」

translations.literal: Zha although not talented, wish attach to Zi Zang righteousness.
translations.idiomatic: Although I, Zha, am not talented, I wish to attach myself to Zizang's righteousness.'

sentences.zh: 吳人固立季札，季札棄其室而耕，乃捨之。

translations.literal: Wu people firmly established Ji Zha, Ji Zha abandoned his residence and farmed, then gave up him.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Wu firmly established Jizha, but Jizha abandoned his residence and farmed, so they then gave up on him.

sentences.zh: 秋，吳伐楚，楚敗我師。

translations.literal: Autumn, Wu attacked Chu, Chu defeated our army.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, Wu attacked Chu, and Chu defeated our army.

sentences.zh: 四年，晉平公初立。

translations.literal: Fourth year, Jin Ping Gong initially established.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Duke Ping of Jin was initially established.

translations.literal: King Zhu Fan first year, Zhu Fan already completed mourning, yielded position to Ji Zha. Ji Zha declined saying: 'When Cao Xuan Gong died, feudal lords and Cao people considered Cao Jun unrighteous, would establish Zi Cang, Zi Cang left, to complete Cao Jun, gentlemen said 'could guard principle'. Lord righteously succeeds, who dares interfere with lord! Having state, not my principle. Zha though incompetent, wishes to attach to Zi Cang's righteousness.' Wu people firmly established Ji Zha, Ji Zha abandoned his chamber and farmed, then let him go. Autumn, Wu attacked Chu, Chu defeated our troops. Fourth year, Jin Ping Gong initially established.

sentences.zh: 十三年，王諸樊卒。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, King Zhu Fan died.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, King Zhufan died.

sentences.zh: 有命授弟餘祭，欲傳以次，必致國於季札而止，以稱先王壽夢之意，且嘉季札之義，兄弟皆欲致國，令以漸至焉。

translations.literal: Had command gave younger brother Yu Ji, wanted transmit in order, must bring state to Ji Zha and stop, to match former king Shou Meng intention, moreover praised Ji Zha righteousness, brothers all wanted bring state, made gradually reach there.
translations.idiomatic: He had a command that gave it to his younger brother Yuji, wanting to transmit it in order. They must bring the state to Jizha and stop there, to match the former king Shoumeng's intention. Moreover, they praised Jizha's righteousness, and the brothers all wanted to bring the state to him, making it gradually reach there.

sentences.zh: 季札封於延陵，故號曰延陵季子。

translations.literal: Ji Zha sealed at Yan Ling, therefore called Yan Ling Ji Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Jizha was enfeoffed at Yanling, and therefore he was called Yanling Jizi.

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, King Zhu Fan died. Had command gave younger brother Yu Ji, wished to transmit in order, must bring state to Ji Zha and stop, to match previous king Shou Meng's intention, moreover praised Ji Zha's righteousness, brothers all wished to bring state, made gradually reach. Ji Zha enfeoffed at Yan Ling, therefore called Yan Ling Ji Zi.

sentences.zh: 王餘祭三年，齊相慶封有罪，自齊來奔吳。

translations.literal: King Yu Ji third year, Qi chancellor Qing Feng had crime, from Qi came fled Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year of King Yuji, Qing Feng, the chancellor of Qi, had committed a crime and came from Qi to flee to Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳予慶封朱方之縣，以為奉邑，以女妻之，富於在齊。

translations.literal: Wu gave Qing Feng Zhu Fang county, as support town, with daughter married him, richer than in Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Wu gave Qing Feng the county of Zhufang as a support town, married a daughter to him, and he was richer than when he was in Qi.

translations.literal: King Yu Ji third year, Qi chancellor Qing Feng had crime, from Qi came fleeing to Wu. Wu gave Qing Feng Zhu Fang county, as support fief, gave daughter to marry him, richer than in Qi.

sentences.zh: 四年，吳使季札聘於魯，請觀周樂。

translations.literal: Fourth year, Wu sent Ji Zha visit Lu, requested view Zhou music.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Wu sent Jizha to visit Lu and requested to view the music of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 為歌周南、召南。

translations.literal: Made sing Zhou Nan, Shao Nan.
translations.idiomatic: They sang the Zhou Nan and Shao Nan.

sentences.zh: 曰：「美哉，始基之矣，猶未也。

translations.literal: Said: 'Beautiful indeed, began foundation it, still not also.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Beautiful indeed! It has begun to lay the foundation, but it is still not complete.

sentences.zh: 然勤而不怨。」

translations.literal: Yet diligent not resent.
translations.idiomatic: Yet it is diligent and does not resent.'

sentences.zh: 歌邶、鄘、衛。

translations.literal: Sang Bei, Yong, Wei.
translations.idiomatic: They sang the Bei, Yong, and Wei.

sentences.zh: 曰：「美哉，淵乎，憂而不困者也。

translations.literal: Said: 'Beautiful indeed, deep indeed, worried not distressed also.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Beautiful indeed, how deep! It is the one who is worried but not distressed.'

sentences.zh: 吾聞衛康叔、武公之德如是，是其衛風乎？」

translations.literal: I heard Wei Kang Shu, Wu Gong virtue like this, is their Wei style?'
translations.idiomatic: I have heard that the virtue of Kang Shu of Wei and Duke Wu was like this. Is this the Wei style?'

sentences.zh: 歌王。

translations.literal: Sang Wang.
translations.idiomatic: They sang the Wang.

sentences.zh: 曰：「美哉，思而不懼，其周之東乎？」

translations.literal: Said: 'Beautiful indeed, thoughtful not fearful, perhaps Zhou east?'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Beautiful indeed! Thoughtful and not fearful. Is this perhaps the east of Zhou?'

sentences.zh: 歌鄭。

translations.literal: Sang Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: They sang the Zheng.

sentences.zh: 曰：「其細已甚，民不堪也，是其先亡乎？」

translations.literal: Said: 'Their small already excessive, people cannot bear also, is their first perish?'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Their refinement is already excessive, and the people cannot bear it. Will they be the first to perish?'

sentences.zh: 歌齊。

translations.literal: Sang Qi.
translations.idiomatic: They sang the Qi.

sentences.zh: 曰：「美哉，泱泱乎大風也哉。

translations.literal: Said: 'Beautiful indeed, vast vast great wind also.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Beautiful indeed! How vast is the great wind!

sentences.zh: 表東海者，其太公乎？

translations.literal: Manifesting east sea, perhaps Tai Gong?
translations.idiomatic: The one who manifests the Eastern Sea, is it perhaps Taigong?

sentences.zh: 國未可量也。」

translations.literal: State not can measure also.
translations.idiomatic: The state cannot be measured.'

sentences.zh: 歌豳。

translations.literal: Sang Bin.
translations.idiomatic: They sang the Bin.

sentences.zh: 曰：「美哉，蕩蕩乎，樂而不淫，其周公之東乎？」

translations.literal: Said: 'Beautiful indeed, broad broad, happy not excessive, perhaps Zhou Gong east?'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Beautiful indeed! How broad! Joyful but not excessive. Is this perhaps the east of the Duke of Zhou?'

sentences.zh: 歌秦。

translations.literal: Sang Qin.
translations.idiomatic: They sang the Qin.

sentences.zh: 曰：「此之謂夏聲。

translations.literal: Said: 'This called Xia sound.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'This is called the sound of Xia.

sentences.zh: 夫能夏則大，大之至也，其周之舊乎？」

translations.literal: Able Xia then great, great utmost, perhaps Zhou old?'
translations.idiomatic: If one can be like Xia, then one is great. Great to the utmost. Is this perhaps the old Zhou?'

sentences.zh: 歌魏。

translations.literal: Sang Wei.
translations.idiomatic: They sang the Wei.

sentences.zh: 曰：「美哉，沨沨乎，大而寬，儉而易，行以德輔，此則盟主也。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Beautiful indeed, grand grand, great and broad, frugal and easy, conduct with virtue assist, this then alliance lord.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Beautiful indeed! How grand! Great and broad, frugal and easy. When conduct is assisted by virtue, this is then the alliance lord.'

sentences.zh: 歌唐。

translations.literal: Sang Tang.
translations.idiomatic: They sang the Tang.

sentences.zh: 曰：「思深哉，其有陶唐氏之遺風乎？

translations.literal: Said: 'Thinking deep indeed, perhaps have Tao Tang clan remaining style?'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'How deep is the thought! Does it have the remaining style of the Taotang clan?

sentences.zh: 不然，何憂之遠也？

translations.literal: Not so, why worry far also?
translations.idiomatic: If not so, why would the worry be so far?

sentences.zh: 非令德之後，誰能若是！」

translations.literal: Not excellent virtue descendants, who could like this!
translations.idiomatic: If not the descendants of excellent virtue, who could be like this!'

sentences.zh: 歌陳。

translations.literal: Sang Chen.
translations.idiomatic: They sang the Chen.

sentences.zh: 曰：「國無主，其能久乎？」

translations.literal: Said: 'State no lord, its can long?'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'If a state has no lord, can it last long?'

sentences.zh: 自鄶以下，無譏焉。

translations.literal: From Huo below, no criticism there.
translations.idiomatic: From Kuai and below, there was no criticism.

sentences.zh: 歌小雅。

translations.literal: Sang Xiao Ya.
translations.idiomatic: They sang the Xiao Ya.

sentences.zh: 曰：「美哉，思而不貳，怨而不言，其周德之衰乎？

translations.literal: Said: 'Beautiful indeed, thoughtful not double, resent not speak, perhaps Zhou virtue decline?'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Beautiful indeed! Thoughtful and not duplicitous, resentful but not speaking. Is this perhaps the decline of Zhou's virtue?

sentences.zh: 猶有先王之遺民也。」

translations.literal: Still have former kings remaining people also.
translations.idiomatic: Still, there are the remaining people of the former kings.'

sentences.zh: 歌大雅。

translations.literal: Sang Da Ya.
translations.idiomatic: They sang the Da Ya.

sentences.zh: 曰：「廣哉，熙熙乎，曲而有直體，其文王之德乎？」

translations.literal: Said: 'Broad indeed, bright bright, curved but has straight body, perhaps Wen Wang virtue?'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'How broad! How bright! Curved but with a straight body. Is this perhaps the virtue of King Wen?'

sentences.zh: 歌頌。

translations.literal: Sang Song.
translations.idiomatic: They sang the Song.

sentences.zh: 曰：「至矣哉，直而不倨，曲而不詘，近而不偪遠而不攜，而遷不淫，復而不厭，哀而不愁，樂而不荒，用而不匱，廣而不宣，施而不費，取而不貪，處而不底，行而不流。

translations.literal: Said: 'Utmost indeed, straight not arrogant, curved not bent, near not press far not carry, migrate not excessive, return not weary, mourn not sad, happy not wild, use not exhaust, broad not advertise, give not spend, take not greedy, reside not sink, conduct not flow.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'The utmost indeed! Straight but not arrogant, curved but not bent, near but not pressing, far but not carrying away. When migrating, not excessive; when returning, not weary. Mournful but not sad, joyful but not wild. When using, not exhausted; when broad, not advertising. When giving, not spending; when taking, not greedy. When residing, not sinking; when conducting, not flowing.'

sentences.zh: 五聲和，八風平，節有度，守有序，盛德之所同也。」

translations.literal: Five sounds harmonious, eight winds peaceful, rhythm has measure, guard has order, flourishing virtue same place also.
translations.idiomatic: The five sounds are harmonious, the eight winds are peaceful, the rhythm has measure, and the guard has order. This is what flourishing virtue has in common.'

sentences.zh: 見舞象箾、南籥者，曰：「美哉，猶有感。」

translations.literal: Saw dance elephant trunk, south flute, said: 'Beautiful indeed, still have emotion.'
translations.idiomatic: When he saw the dance of the elephant trunk and the south flute, he said: 'Beautiful indeed! Still there is emotion.'

sentences.zh: 見舞大武，曰：「美哉，周之盛也其若此乎？」

translations.literal: Saw dance great martial, said: 'Beautiful indeed, Zhou flourishing perhaps like this?'
translations.idiomatic: When he saw the dance of the Great Martial, he said: 'Beautiful indeed! Is the flourishing of Zhou like this?'

sentences.zh: 見舞韶護者，曰：「聖人之弘也，猶有慚德，聖人之難也！」

translations.literal: Saw dance Shao Hu, said: 'Sage great also, still have shame virtue, sage difficult also!'
translations.idiomatic: When he saw the dance of Shao Hu, he said: 'The greatness of the sage! Still there is shame in virtue. How difficult it is to be a sage!'

sentences.zh: 見舞大夏，曰：「美哉，勤而不德！

translations.literal: Saw dance great Xia, said: 'Beautiful indeed, diligent not virtue!'
translations.idiomatic: When he saw the dance of the Great Xia, he said: 'Beautiful indeed! Diligent and not claiming virtue!

sentences.zh: 非禹其誰能及之？」

translations.literal: Not Yu who could reach it?
translations.idiomatic: If not Yu, who could reach it?'

sentences.zh: 見舞招箾，曰：「德至矣哉，大矣，如天之無不燾也，如地之無不載也，雖甚盛德，無以加矣。

translations.literal: Saw dance Zhao trunk, said: 'Virtue utmost indeed, great indeed, like heaven no not cover also, like earth no not carry also, although very flourishing virtue, nothing add.'
translations.idiomatic: When he saw the dance of Zhao Shuo, he said: 'Virtue has reached the utmost indeed! How great! Like heaven, there is nothing it does not cover; like earth, there is nothing it does not carry. Although the virtue is very flourishing, there is nothing to add to it.

sentences.zh: 觀止矣，若有他樂，吾不敢觀。」

translations.literal: View stop, if have other music, I not dare view.
translations.idiomatic: The viewing stops here. If there is other music, I dare not view it.'

translations.literal: Fourth year, Wu sent Ji Zha visit to Lu, requested to observe Zhou music. Sang Zhou Nan, Zhao Nan. Said: 'Beautiful, foundation begun, still not yet. But diligent without resentment.' Sang Bei, Yong, Wei. Said: 'Beautiful, profound, worried without distress. I heard Wei Kang Shu, Wu Gong's virtue like this, is this Wei wind?' Sang Wang. Said: 'Beautiful, thoughtful without fear, perhaps Zhou's east?' Sang Zheng. Said: 'Its meticulous too much, people cannot bear, is this first to perish?' Sang Qi. Said: 'Beautiful, vast great wind. Manifesting eastern sea, perhaps Tai Gong? State cannot be measured.' Sang Bin. Said: 'Beautiful, vast, happy without excess, perhaps Zhou Gong's east?' Sang Qin. Said: 'This called Xia sound. Able Xia then great, great to utmost, perhaps Zhou's old?' Sang Wei. Said: 'Beautiful, vast, great and broad, frugal and easy, act with virtue assist, this then hegemon lord.' Sang Tang. Said: 'Thought deep, has Yao Tang Shi's remaining wind? Not so, why worry far? Not excellent virtue's descendant, who can be like this!' Sang Chen. Said: 'State without lord, can it last?' From Kou below, no criticism. Sang Little Ya. Said: 'Beautiful, thoughtful without double, resent without speak, perhaps Zhou virtue's decline? Still has previous kings' remaining people.' Sang Great Ya. Said: 'Broad, bright, curved but has straight body, perhaps Wen Wang's virtue?' Sang Song. Said: 'Supreme, upright without arrogance, curved without bend, close without press far without alienate, change not lewd, return not weary, mourn not sad, happy not wild, use not exhaust, broad not publicize, give not spend, take not greedy, reside not bottom, act not flow. Five sounds harmonious, eight winds peaceful, section has measure, guard has order, flourishing virtue's common.' Saw dance Xiang Zhao, Nan Yue, said: 'Beautiful, still has feeling.' Saw dance Da Wu, said: 'Beautiful, Zhou's flourishing like this?' Saw dance Shao Hu, said: 'Sage's vastness, still has ashamed virtue, sage's difficulty!' Saw dance Da Xia, said: 'Beautiful, diligent without self-praise! Not Yu who could reach it?' Saw dance Zhao Zhao, said: 'Virtue reached, great, like heaven's nothing not covering, like earth's nothing not carrying, though flourishing virtue, nothing to add. Viewing stopped, if have other music, I dare not view.'

sentences.zh: 去魯，遂使齊。

translations.literal: Left Lu, then envoy Qi.
translations.idiomatic: He left Lu and then went as an envoy to Qi.

sentences.zh: 說晏平仲曰：「子速納邑與政。

translations.literal: Persuaded Yan Ping Zhong said: 'You quickly return towns and government.'
translations.idiomatic: He persuaded Yan Pingzhong and said: 'You must quickly return your towns and government.

sentences.zh: 無邑無政，乃免於難。

translations.literal: No towns no government, then avoid difficulty.'
translations.idiomatic: With no towns and no government, you will then avoid difficulty.'

sentences.zh: 齊國之政將有所歸；

translations.literal: Qi state government will have place belong;
translations.idiomatic: The government of the state of Qi will have a place to belong;

sentences.zh: 未得所歸，難未息也。」

translations.literal: Not got belong place, difficulty not cease also.
translations.idiomatic: before it gets the place to belong, the difficulty will not cease.'

sentences.zh: 故晏子因陳桓子以納政與邑，是以免於欒高之難。

translations.literal: Therefore Yan Zi through Chen Huan Zi to return government and towns, therefore avoided Luan Gao difficulty.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, Yanzi, through Chen Huanzi, returned the government and towns, and thus avoided the difficulty of Luan and Gao.

translations.literal: Left Lu, then sent to Qi. Persuaded Yan Ping Zhong: 'You quickly take fief and government. No fief no government, then avoid difficulty. Qi state's government will have place to return; Not obtained where to return, difficulty not ceased.' Therefore Yan Zi through Chen Huan Zi to take government and fief, therefore avoided Luan Gao's difficulty.

sentences.zh: 去齊，使於鄭。

translations.literal: Left Qi, envoy Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: He left Qi and went as an envoy to Zheng.

sentences.zh: 見子產，如舊交。

translations.literal: Saw Zi Chan, like old friend.
translations.idiomatic: He saw Zichan, and it was like meeting an old friend.

sentences.zh: 謂子產曰：「鄭之執政侈，難將至矣，政必及子。

translations.literal: Told Zi Chan said: 'Zheng administrators extravagant, difficulty will arrive, government must reach you.'
translations.idiomatic: He told Zichan and said: 'The administrators of Zheng are extravagant, and difficulty will arrive. The government must reach you.

sentences.zh: 子為政，慎以禮。

translations.literal: You govern, careful with rites.'
translations.idiomatic: When you govern, be careful with the rites.'

sentences.zh: 不然，鄭國將敗。」

translations.literal: Not so, Zheng state will be defeated.'
translations.idiomatic: If not so, the state of Zheng will be defeated.'

sentences.zh: 去鄭，適衛。

translations.literal: Left Zheng, went to Wei.
translations.idiomatic: He left Zheng and went to Wei.

sentences.zh: 說蘧瑗、史狗、史、公子荊、公叔發、公子朝曰：「衛多君子，未有患也。」

translations.literal: Persuaded Qu Yuan, Shi Gou, Shi, Gongzi Jing, Gongshu Fa, Gongzi Zhao said: 'Wei many gentlemen, not yet have worry.'
translations.idiomatic: He persuaded Qu Yuan, Shi Gou, Shi, Gongzi Jing, Gongshu Fa, and Gongzi Zhao and said: 'The state of Wei has many gentlemen, and there will be no worry.'

translations.literal: Left Qi, sent to Zheng. Saw Zi Chan, like old friend. Told Zi Chan: 'Zheng's administration extravagant, difficulty will arrive, government must reach you. You administer government, careful with rites. Not so, Zheng state will fail.' Left Zheng, went to Wei. Persuaded Qu Yuan, Shi Gou, Shi, Gong Zi Jing, Gong Shu Fa, Gong Zi Zhao: 'Wei has many gentlemen, not yet have trouble.'

sentences.zh: 自衛如晉，將舍於宿，聞鐘聲，曰：「異哉！

translations.literal: From Wei went to Jin, will lodge at Su, heard bell sound, said: 'Strange indeed!'
translations.idiomatic: From Wei he went to Jin, and was about to lodge at Su when he heard the sound of bells. He said: 'How strange indeed!'

sentences.zh: 吾聞之，辯而不德，必加於戮。

translations.literal: I heard it, clever but not virtue, must add to punishment.'
translations.idiomatic: I have heard that when one is clever but without virtue, punishment must be added.'

sentences.zh: 夫子獲罪於君以在此，懼猶不足，而又可以畔乎？

translations.literal: Master got crime from ruler because of this here, fear still insufficient, and moreover can rebel?
translations.idiomatic: The master has gotten a crime from the ruler and is here because of it. Fear is still insufficient, and moreover, can one rebel?

sentences.zh: 夫子之在此，猶燕之巢于幕也。

translations.literal: Master's being here, like swallow's nesting on tent.'
translations.idiomatic: The master's being here is like a swallow nesting on a tent.'

sentences.zh: 君在殯而可以樂乎？」

translations.literal: Ruler in coffin and can be happy?'
translations.idiomatic: The ruler is in the coffin, and can one be happy?'

sentences.zh: 遂去之。

translations.literal: Then left it.
translations.idiomatic: Then he left it.

sentences.zh: 文子聞之，終身不聽琴瑟。

translations.literal: Wenzi heard it, lifetime not listen to zither and se.
translations.idiomatic: Wenzi heard it, and for the rest of his life he did not listen to the zither and se.

translations.literal: From Wei went to Jin, would lodge at Su, heard bell sound, said: 'Strange! I heard, clever but not virtuous, must add to punishment. Master obtained crime from lord to be here, fear still insufficient, moreover can rebel? Master's being here, like swallow nesting on curtain. Lord in mourning can enjoy music?' Therefore left it. Wen Zi heard it, lifetime not listened to qin se.

sentences.zh: 適晉，說趙文子、韓宣子、魏獻子曰：「晉國其萃於三家乎！」

translations.literal: Went to Jin, persuaded Zhao Wenzi, Han Xuanzi, Wei Xianzi said: 'Jin state perhaps gather at three families!'
translations.idiomatic: He went to Jin and persuaded Zhao Wenzi, Han Xuanzi, and Wei Xianzi and said: 'The state of Jin will perhaps gather at the three families!'

sentences.zh: 將去，謂叔向曰：「吾子勉之！

translations.literal: About to leave, told Shuxiang said: 'My son strive!'
translations.idiomatic: When he was about to leave, he told Shuxiang and said: 'My son, strive!

sentences.zh: 君侈而多良，大夫皆富，政將在三家。

translations.literal: Ruler extravagant and many worthy, grand masters all rich, government will be in three families.'
translations.idiomatic: The ruler is extravagant and has many worthy men, and the grand masters are all rich. The government will be in the three families.'

sentences.zh: 吾子直，必思自免於難。」

translations.literal: My son upright, must think self avoid difficulty.'
translations.idiomatic: My son, you are upright. You must think of how to avoid difficulty yourself.'

translations.literal: Went to Jin, persuaded Zhao Wen Zi, Han Xuan Zi, Wei Xian Zi: 'Jin state perhaps will gather at three families?' About to leave, told Shu Xiang: 'My son strive! Lord extravagant many worthy, grand masters all rich, government will be at three families. My son upright, must think self avoid difficulty.'

sentences.zh: 季札之初使，北過徐君。

translations.literal: Jizha's first envoy mission, north passed Xu ruler.
translations.idiomatic: When Jizha first went as an envoy, he passed north by the ruler of Xu.

sentences.zh: 徐君好季札劍，口弗敢言。

translations.literal: Xu ruler liked Jizha's sword, mouth not dare speak.
translations.idiomatic: The ruler of Xu liked Jizha's sword, but did not dare to speak of it.

sentences.zh: 季札心知之，為使上國，未獻。

translations.literal: Jizha heart knew it, for envoy upper state, not yet presented.
translations.idiomatic: Jizha knew it in his heart, but because he was an envoy to the upper state, he had not yet presented it.

sentences.zh: 還至徐，徐君已死，於是乃解其寶劍，系之徐君冢樹而去。

translations.literal: Returned to Xu, Xu ruler already died, therefore then untied his precious sword, tied it Xu ruler tomb tree and left.
translations.idiomatic: When he returned to Xu, the ruler of Xu had already died. Therefore, he untied his precious sword and tied it to a tree at the ruler of Xu's tomb, then left.

sentences.zh: 從者曰：「徐君已死，尚誰予乎？」

translations.literal: Followers said: 'Xu ruler already died, still who give?'
translations.idiomatic: His followers said: 'The ruler of Xu has already died. To whom are you still giving it?'

sentences.zh: 季子曰：「不然。

translations.literal: Jizi said: 'Not so.'
translations.idiomatic: Jizi said: 'Not so.

sentences.zh: 始吾心已許之，豈以死倍吾心哉！」

translations.literal: Beginning my heart already promised it, how with death betray my heart!'
translations.idiomatic: From the beginning, my heart had already promised it to him. How can I betray my heart because of death!'

translations.literal: Ji Zha's initial mission, north passed Xu Jun. Xu Jun liked Ji Zha's sword, mouth dared not speak. Ji Zha heart knew it, for mission to upper state, not presented. Returned to Xu, Xu Jun already dead, then untied his precious sword, tied to Xu Jun's tomb tree and left. Followers said: 'Xu Jun already dead, still give to whom?' Ji Zi said: 'Not so. At first my heart already promised it, how with death betray my heart!'

sentences.zh: 七年，楚公子圍弒其王夾敖而代立，是為靈王。

translations.literal: Seventh year, Chu Gongzi Wei assassinated his king Jia Ao and replaced established, this was Ling Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Chu's Gongzi Wei assassinated his king Jia Ao and replaced him, establishing himself. This was King Ling.

sentences.zh: 十年，楚靈王會諸侯而以伐吳之朱方，以誅齊慶封。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Chu Ling Wang assembled feudal lords and with attacked Wu's Zhu Fang, to execute Qi Qing Feng.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, King Ling of Chu assembled the feudal lords and attacked Zhu Fang of Wu, in order to execute Qing Feng of Qi.

sentences.zh: 吳亦攻楚，取三邑而去。

translations.literal: Wu also attacked Chu, took three towns and left.
translations.idiomatic: Wu also attacked Chu, took three towns, and then left.

sentences.zh: 十一年，楚伐吳，至雩婁。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Chu attacked Wu, reached Yu Lou.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Chu attacked Wu and reached Yu Lou.

sentences.zh: 十二年，楚復來伐，次於乾谿，楚師敗走。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Chu again came attacked, stationed at Qian Xi, Chu army defeated fled.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Chu again came to attack and stationed at Qian Xi, but the Chu army was defeated and fled.

translations.literal: Seventh year, Chu Gong Zi Wei assassinated his king Jia Ao and replaced established, this was Ling Wang. Tenth year, Chu Ling Wang assembled feudal lords and attacked Wu's Zhu Fang, to punish Qi Qing Feng. Wu also attacked Chu, took three cities and left. Eleventh year, Chu attacked Wu, reached Yu Lou. Twelfth year, Chu again came attack, stationed at Qian Xi, Chu troops defeated fled.

sentences.zh: 十七年，王餘祭卒，弟餘眛立。

translations.literal: Seventeenth year, King Yu Ji died, younger brother Yu Mei established.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, King Yuji died, and his younger brother Yumei was established.

sentences.zh: 王餘眛二年，楚公子棄疾弒其君靈王代立焉。

translations.literal: King Yu Mei second year, Chu Gongzi Qi Ji assassinated his ruler Ling Wang replaced established there.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year of King Yumei, Chu's Gongzi Qiji assassinated his ruler King Ling and replaced him, establishing himself.

translations.literal: Seventeenth year, King Yu Ji died, younger brother Yu Mei established. King Yu Mei second year, Chu Gong Zi Qi Ji assassinated his lord Ling Wang replaced established.

sentences.zh: 四年，王餘眛卒，欲授弟季札。

translations.literal: Fourth year, King Yu Mei died, wanted give younger brother Jizha.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, King Yumei died and wanted to give the throne to his younger brother Jizha.

sentences.zh: 季札讓，逃去。

translations.literal: Jizha declined, fled away.
translations.idiomatic: Jizha declined and fled away.

sentences.zh: 於是吳人曰：「先王有命，兄卒弟代立，必致季子。

translations.literal: Therefore Wu people said: 'Former king had command, elder brother died younger brother replaced established, must bring Jizi.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the people of Wu said: 'The former king had a command that when an elder brother died, a younger brother should replace him and be established. We must bring Jizi.'

sentences.zh: 季子今逃位，則王餘眛後立。

translations.literal: Jizi now fled position, then King Yu Mei later established.
translations.idiomatic: Jizi has now fled the position, so King Yumei was later established.

sentences.zh: 今卒，其子當代。」

translations.literal: Now died, his son should replace.'
translations.idiomatic: Now that he has died, his son should replace him.'

sentences.zh: 乃立王餘眛之子僚為王。

translations.literal: Then established King Yu Mei son Liao as king.
translations.idiomatic: Then they established King Yumei's son Liao as king.

translations.literal: Fourth year, King Yu Mei died, wished to give younger brother Ji Zha. Ji Zha declined, fled away. Therefore Wu people said: 'Previous king had command, elder brother die younger brother replace establish, must bring to Ji Zi. Ji Zi now flees position, then after Yu Mei established. Now died, his son should replace.' Then established King Yu Mei's son Liao as king.

sentences.zh: 王僚二年，公子光伐楚，敗而亡王舟。

translations.literal: King Liao second year, Gongzi Guang attacked Chu, defeated and lost king boat.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year of King Liao, Gongzi Guang attacked Chu, was defeated, and lost the king's boat.

sentences.zh: 光懼，襲楚，復得王舟而還。

translations.literal: Guang feared, raided Chu, again got king boat and returned.
translations.idiomatic: Guang was afraid, so he raided Chu, again got the king's boat, and returned.

translations.literal: King Liao second year, Gong Zi Guang attacked Chu, defeated and lost king's boat. Guang feared, attacked Chu, again obtained king's boat and returned.

sentences.zh: 五年，楚之亡臣伍子胥來奔，公子光客之。

translations.literal: Fifth year, Chu exiled minister Wu Zixu came fled, Gongzi Guang guest treated him.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Chu's exiled minister Wu Zixu came fleeing, and Gongzi Guang treated him as a guest.

sentences.zh: 公子光者，王諸樊之子也。

translations.literal: Gongzi Guang was, King Zhufan's son also.
translations.idiomatic: Gongzi Guang was the son of King Zhufan.

sentences.zh: 常以為吾父兄弟四人，當傳至季子。

translations.literal: Often considered my father brothers four people, should transmit to Jizi.
translations.idiomatic: He often considered that the four brothers of my father should transmit the throne to Jizi.

sentences.zh: 季子即不受國，光父先立。

translations.literal: Jizi namely not accepted state, Guang father first established.
translations.idiomatic: If Jizi does not accept the state, then Guang's father was first established.

sentences.zh: 即不傳季子，光當立。

translations.literal: Namely not transmit Jizi, Guang should establish.
translations.idiomatic: If it is not transmitted to Jizi, then Guang should be established.

sentences.zh: 陰納賢士，欲以襲王僚。

translations.literal: Secretly received worthy scholars, wanted to raid King Liao.
translations.idiomatic: He secretly received worthy scholars, wanting to use them to raid King Liao.

translations.literal: Fifth year, Chu's fugitive minister Wu Zi Xu came fleeing, Gong Zi Guang guest treated him. Gong Zi Guang was King Zhu Fan's son. Often considered my father brothers four people, should transmit to Ji Zi. Ji Zi namely not accept state, Guang father first established. Namely not transmit Ji Zi, Guang should establish. Secretly accepted worthy scholars, wished to attack King Liao.

sentences.zh: 八年，吳使公子光伐楚，敗楚師，迎楚故太子建母於居巢以歸。

translations.literal: Eighth year, Wu sent Gongzi Guang attacked Chu, defeated Chu army, welcomed Chu former crown prince Jian mother at Ju Chao to return.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Wu sent Gongzi Guang to attack Chu. He defeated the Chu army and welcomed the mother of Chu's former crown prince Jian from Ju Chao and returned.

sentences.zh: 因北伐，敗陳、蔡之師。

translations.literal: Because of north attacked, defeated Chen, Cai armies.
translations.idiomatic: Because of the northern attack, he defeated the armies of Chen and Cai.

sentences.zh: 九年，公子光伐楚，拔居巢、鐘離。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Gongzi Guang attacked Chu, captured Ju Chao, Zhong Li.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Gongzi Guang attacked Chu and captured Ju Chao and Zhong Li.

sentences.zh: 初，楚邊邑卑梁氏之處女與吳邊邑之女爭桑，二女家怒相滅，兩國邊邑長聞之，怒而相攻，滅吳之邊邑。

translations.literal: Initially, Chu border town Beiliang clan virgin with Wu border town girl contended mulberry, two girls families angry mutually extinguished, two states border town chiefs heard it, angry mutually attacked, extinguished Wu border town.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, a virgin from the Beiliang clan of a Chu border town contended with a girl from a Wu border town over mulberry trees. The two girls' families became angry and destroyed each other. The chiefs of the border towns of both states heard of it, became angry, and attacked each other, destroying Wu's border town.

sentences.zh: 吳王怒，故遂伐楚，取兩都而去。

translations.literal: Wu king angered, therefore then attacked Chu, took two capitals and left.
translations.idiomatic: The king of Wu was angered, and therefore attacked Chu, took two capitals, and left.

translations.literal: Eighth year, Wu sent Gong Zi Guang attack Chu, defeated Chu troops, welcomed Chu former crown prince Jian's mother at Ju Chao to return. Then north attacked, defeated Chen, Cai troops. Ninth year, Gong Zi Guang attacked Chu, captured Ju Chao, Zhong Li. Initially, Chu border city Bei Liang Shi's virgin girl disputed mulberry with Wu border city's girl, two girls' families angered mutually destroyed, two countries border city chiefs heard it, angered mutually attacked, extinguished Wu's border city. Wu king angered, therefore attacked Chu, took two capitals and left.

sentences.zh: 伍子胥之初奔吳，說吳王僚以伐楚之利。

translations.literal: Wu Zixu's initial fled to Wu, persuaded Wu king Liao with attacked Chu benefits.
translations.idiomatic: When Wu Zixu first fled to Wu, he persuaded King Liao of Wu about the benefits of attacking Chu.

sentences.zh: 公子光曰：「胥之父兄為僇於楚，欲自報其仇耳。

translations.literal: Gongzi Guang said: 'Xu's father elder brothers were executed by Chu, wanted self avenge their enmity only.'
translations.idiomatic: Gongzi Guang said: 'Xu's father and elder brothers were executed by the state of Chu. He only wants to avenge his enmity himself.'

sentences.zh: 未見其利。」

translations.literal: Not seen its benefits.'
translations.idiomatic: I do not see the benefits.'

sentences.zh: 於是伍員知光有他志，乃求勇士專諸，見之光。

translations.literal: Therefore Wu Yuan knew Guang had other intentions, then sought brave warrior Zhuan Zhu, introduced him to Guang.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, Wu Yuan knew that Guang had other intentions, so he sought the brave warrior Zhuan Zhu and introduced him to Guang.

sentences.zh: 光喜，乃客伍子胥。

translations.literal: Guang happy, then guest treated Wu Zixu.
translations.idiomatic: Guang was happy and then treated Wu Zixu as a guest.

sentences.zh: 子胥退而耕於野，以待專諸之事。

translations.literal: Zixu withdrew and farmed in fields, to await Zhuan Zhu affair.
translations.idiomatic: Zixu withdrew and farmed in the fields, waiting for Zhuan Zhu's affair.

translations.literal: Wu Zi Xu's initial flight to Wu, persuaded Wu King Liao with attacking Chu's benefits. Gong Zi Guang said: 'Xu's father elder brother executed by Chu, wishes self report his enmity. Not seen its benefits.' Therefore Wu Yuan knew Guang had other intentions, then sought brave man Zhuan Zhu, saw Guang. Guang pleased, then guest treated Wu Zi Xu. Zi Xu retreated farmed in fields, to wait Zhuan Zhu's affair.

sentences.zh: 十二年冬，楚平王卒。

translations.literal: Twelfth year winter, Chu Ping Wang died.
translations.idiomatic: In the winter of the twelfth year, King Ping of Chu died.

sentences.zh: 十三年春，吳欲因楚喪而伐之，使公子蓋餘、燭庸以兵圍楚之六、𤅬。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year spring, Wu wanted to take advantage Chu mourning attacked it, sent Gongzi Gai Yu, Zhu Yong with troops surrounded Chu Liu, Xi.
translations.idiomatic: In the spring of the thirteenth year, Wu wanted to take advantage of Chu's mourning to attack it. They sent Gongzi Gai Yu and Zhu Yong with troops to surround Liu and Xi of Chu.

sentences.zh: 使季札於晉，以觀諸侯之變。

translations.literal: Sent Jizha to Jin, to observe feudal lords changes.
translations.idiomatic: They sent Jizha to Jin to observe the changes among the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 楚發兵絕吳兵後，吳兵不得還。

translations.literal: Chu sent troops cut off Wu troops rear, Wu troops could not return.
translations.idiomatic: Chu sent troops to cut off the rear of the Wu troops, and the Wu troops could not return.

sentences.zh: 於是吳公子光曰：「此時不可失也。」

translations.literal: Therefore Wu Gongzi Guang said: 'This time cannot lose also.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, Wu's Gongzi Guang said: 'This is an opportunity that cannot be lost.'

sentences.zh: 告專諸曰：「不索何獲！

translations.literal: Told Zhuan Zhu said: 'Not search what gain!'
translations.idiomatic: He told Zhuan Zhu and said: 'If we do not seek, what will we gain!

sentences.zh: 我真王嗣，當立，吾欲求之。

translations.literal: I true king successor, should establish, I want seek it.'
translations.idiomatic: I am the true king's successor and should be established. I want to seek it.'

sentences.zh: 季子雖至，不吾廢也。」

translations.literal: Jizi though arrived, not me abolish also.'
translations.idiomatic: Even if Jizi arrives, he will not abolish me.'

sentences.zh: 專諸曰：「王僚可殺也。

translations.literal: Zhuan Zhu said: 'King Liao can kill also.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhuan Zhu said: 'King Liao can be killed.

sentences.zh: 母老子弱，而兩公子將兵攻楚，楚絕其路。

translations.literal: Mother old son weak, and two princes lead troops attack Chu, Chu cut off their road.
translations.idiomatic: His mother is old and his son is weak, and the two princes are leading troops to attack Chu. Chu has cut off their road.

sentences.zh: 方今吳外困於楚，而內空無骨鯁之臣，是無柰我何。」

translations.literal: Right now Wu externally troubled by Chu, and internally empty without backbone ministers, this has no way to do what to me.'
translations.idiomatic: Right now, the state of Wu is externally troubled by Chu, and internally empty without ministers of backbone. There is no way they can do anything to me.'

sentences.zh: 光曰：「我身，子之身也。」

translations.literal: Guang said: 'My body, your body also.'
translations.idiomatic: Guang said: 'My body is your body.'

sentences.zh: 四月丙子，光伏甲士於窟室，而謁王僚飲。

translations.literal: Fourth month Bing Zi, Guang hid armored soldiers in cave room, and invited King Liao to drink.
translations.idiomatic: On the day Bing Zi of the fourth month, Guang hid armored soldiers in a cave room and invited King Liao to drink.

sentences.zh: 王僚使兵陳於道，自王宮至光之家，門階戶席，皆王僚之親也，人夾持鈹。

translations.literal: King Liao made troops array on road, from palace to Guang home, door steps household mats, all King Liao relatives also, people flanked holding halberds.
translations.idiomatic: King Liao made troops array on the road from the palace to Guang's home. At the doors, steps, and household mats, all were King Liao's relatives, and people flanked them holding halberds.

sentences.zh: 公子光詳為足疾，入于窟室，使專諸置匕首於炙魚之中以進食。

translations.literal: Gongzi Guang pretended foot illness, entered cave room, made Zhuan Zhu place dagger in roasted fish middle to present food.
translations.idiomatic: Gongzi Guang pretended to have a foot illness and entered the cave room. He made Zhuan Zhu place a dagger in the middle of a roasted fish to present the food.

sentences.zh: 手匕首刺王僚，鈹交於匈，遂弒王僚。

translations.literal: Took dagger stabbed King Liao, halberds crossed at chest, then assassinated King Liao.
translations.idiomatic: He took the dagger and stabbed King Liao. The halberds crossed at his chest, and then he assassinated King Liao.

sentences.zh: 公子光竟代立為王，是為吳王闔廬。

translations.literal: Gongzi Guang finally replaced established as king, this was Wu king Helu.
translations.idiomatic: Gongzi Guang finally replaced him and was established as king. This was King Helu of the state of Wu.

sentences.zh: 闔廬乃以專諸子為卿。

translations.literal: Helu then made Zhuan Zhu son as minister.
translations.idiomatic: Helu then made Zhuan Zhu's son a minister.

translations.literal: Twelfth year winter, Chu Ping Wang died. Thirteenth year spring, Wu wished to take advantage Chu mourning to attack it, sent Gong Zi Gai Yu, Zhu Yong with troops surrounded Chu's Liu, Dang. Sent Ji Zha to Jin, to observe feudal lords' changes. Chu sent troops cut off Wu troops' rear, Wu troops could not return. Therefore Wu Gong Zi Guang said: 'This time cannot lose.' Told Zhuan Zhu: 'Not seek how obtain! I true king heir, should establish, I wish seek it. Ji Zi though arrive, not depose me.' Zhuan Zhu said: 'King Liao can kill. Mother old son weak, two gong zi lead troops attack Chu, Chu cuts their road. Now Wu externally troubled by Chu, internally empty no backbone ministers, is nothing can do to me.' Guang said: 'My body, your body.' Fourth month Bing Zi, Guang hid armored soldiers in cave room, invited King Liao drink. King Liao made troops array on road, from king palace to Guang's home, doors thresholds seats, all King Liao's relatives, people flanked held halberds. Gong Zi Guang feigned foot illness, entered cave room, made Zhuan Zhu place dagger in roasted fish to advance food. Hand dagger stabbed King Liao, halberds crossed at chest, then assassinated King Liao. Gong Zi Guang finally replaced established as king, this was Wu King He Lu. He Lu then made Zhuan Zhu's son minister.

sentences.zh: 季子至，曰：「茍先君無廢祀，民人無廢主，社稷有奉，乃吾君也。

translations.literal: Jizi arrived, said: 'If late lord no abolished sacrifices, people no abolished lord, state has sustenance, then my lord also.'
translations.idiomatic: Jizi arrived and said: 'If the late lord's sacrifices are not abolished, and the people have not abolished their lord, and the state has sustenance, then he is my lord.

sentences.zh: 吾敢誰怨乎？

translations.literal: I dare who resent?'
translations.idiomatic: How dare I feel resentment toward anyone?'

sentences.zh: 哀死事生，以待天命。

translations.literal: Mourn dead serve living, to await heaven mandate.
translations.idiomatic: I will mourn the dead and serve the living, awaiting the mandate of heaven.

sentences.zh: 非我生亂，立者從之，先人之道也。」

translations.literal: Not I created chaos, established one follow him, ancestors way also.'
translations.idiomatic: I did not create chaos. I follow the one who is established. This is the way of the ancestors.'

sentences.zh: 復命，哭僚墓，復位而待。

translations.literal: Returned command, cried at Liao tomb, returned position and waited.
translations.idiomatic: He returned from his mission, cried at Liao's tomb, returned to his position, and waited.

sentences.zh: 吳公子燭庸、蓋餘二人將兵遇圍於楚者，聞公子光弒王僚自立，乃以其兵降楚，楚封之於舒。

translations.literal: Wu princes Zhu Yong, Gai Yu two led troops surrounded by Chu, heard Gongzi Guang assassinated King Liao self-established, then with their troops surrendered Chu, Chu enfeoffed them at Shu.
translations.idiomatic: The two Wu princes Zhu Yong and Gai Yu, who were leading troops and had been surrounded by Chu, heard that Gongzi Guang had assassinated King Liao and established himself. Then they surrendered to Chu with their troops, and Chu enfeoffed them at Shu.

translations.literal: Ji Zi arrived, said: 'If previous lord not abolish sacrifices, people not abolish lord, altars have support, then my lord. I dare resent whom? Mourn dead serve living, await heaven's mandate. Not I create disorder, established follows it, previous people's way.' Reported back, cried at Liao's tomb, returned position and waited. Wu gong zi Zhu Yong, Gai Yu two people led troops met surrounded by Chu, heard Gong Zi Guang assassinated King Liao self established, then with their troops surrendered Chu, Chu enfeoffed at Shu.

sentences.zh: 王闔廬元年，舉伍子胥為行人而與謀國事。

translations.literal: King Helu first year, raised Wu Zixu as envoy and with him planned state affairs.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of King Helu, he raised Wu Zixu as an envoy and planned state affairs with him.

sentences.zh: 楚誅伯州犁，其孫伯嚭亡奔吳，吳以為大夫。

translations.literal: Chu executed Bo Zhouli, his grandson Bo Pi fled to Wu, Wu made him grand master.
translations.idiomatic: Chu executed Bo Zhouli, and his grandson Bo Pi fled to Wu. Wu made him a grand master.

translations.literal: King He Lu first year, raised Wu Zi Xu as messenger and with him planned state affairs. Chu executed Bo Zhou Li, his grandson Bo Pi fled to Wu, Wu made him grand master.

sentences.zh: 三年，吳王闔廬與子胥、伯嚭將兵伐楚，拔舒，殺吳亡將二公子。

translations.literal: Third year, Wu king Helu with Zixu, Bo Pi led troops attacked Chu, captured Shu, killed Wu fleeing generals two princes.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, King Helu of Wu, together with Zixu and Bo Pi, led troops to attack Chu. They captured Shu and killed the two Wu princes who were fleeing generals.

sentences.zh: 光謀欲入郢，將軍孫武曰：「民勞，未可，待之。」

translations.literal: Guang planned wanted enter Ying, general Sun Wu said: 'People tired, not yet possible, wait for it.'
translations.idiomatic: Guang planned to enter Ying, but General Sun Wu said: 'The people are tired. It is not yet possible. Wait for it.'

sentences.zh: 四年，伐楚，取六與𤅬。

translations.literal: Fourth year, attacked Chu, took Liu and Xi.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, they attacked Chu and took Liu and Xi.

sentences.zh: 五年，伐越，敗之。

translations.literal: Fifth year, attacked Yue, defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, they attacked Yue and defeated them.

sentences.zh: 六年，楚使子常囊瓦伐吳。

translations.literal: Sixth year, Chu sent Zi Chang Nang Wa attacked Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Chu sent Zichang Nang Wa to attack Wu.

sentences.zh: 迎而擊之，大敗楚軍於豫章，取楚之居巢而還。

translations.literal: Met and attacked them, greatly defeated Chu army at Yuzhang, took Chu's Ju Chao and returned.
translations.idiomatic: They met and attacked them, greatly defeated the Chu army at Yuzhang, took Chu's Ju Chao, and returned.

translations.literal: Third year, Wu King He Lu with Zi Xu, Bo Pi led troops attacked Chu, captured Shu, killed Wu's fled generals two gong zi. Guang planned wished enter Ying, general Sun Wu said: 'People tired, not possible, wait it.' Fourth year, attacked Chu, took Liu and Dang. Fifth year, attacked Yue, defeated it. Sixth year, Chu sent Zi Chang Nang Wa attacked Wu. Welcomed and attacked it, greatly defeated Chu army at Yu Zhang, took Chu's Ju Chao and returned.

sentences.zh: 九年，吳王闔廬請伍子胥、孫武曰：「始子之言郢未可入，今果如何？」

translations.literal: Ninth year, Wu king Helu asked Wu Zixu, Sun Wu said: 'Initially your words Ying not yet enterable, now indeed how?'
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, King Helu of Wu asked Wu Zixu and Sun Wu and said: 'Initially, your words were that Ying was not yet enterable. Now, how is it indeed?'

sentences.zh: 二子對曰：「楚將子常貪，而唐、蔡皆怨之。

translations.literal: Two gentlemen replied said: 'Chu general Zi Chang greedy, and Tang, Cai all resent him.'
translations.idiomatic: The two gentlemen replied and said: 'Chu's general Zichang is greedy, and both Tang and Cai resent him.

sentences.zh: 王必欲大伐，必得唐、蔡乃可。」

translations.literal: King must want great attack, must get Tang, Cai then possible.'
translations.idiomatic: If the king must want a great attack, you must get Tang and Cai, then it is possible.'

sentences.zh: 闔廬從之，悉興師，與唐、蔡西伐楚，至於漢水。

translations.literal: Helu followed this, completely raised troops, with Tang, Cai west attacked Chu, arrived at Han water.
translations.idiomatic: Helu followed this, completely raised troops, and together with Tang and Cai, attacked Chu to the west, arriving at the Han River.

sentences.zh: 楚亦發兵拒吳，夾水陳。

translations.literal: Chu also sent troops to resist Wu, flanked water arrayed.
translations.idiomatic: Chu also sent troops to resist Wu and arrayed them flanking the water.

sentences.zh: 吳王闔廬弟夫欲戰，闔廬弗許。

translations.literal: Wu king Helu younger brother Fu wanted battle, Helu not permitted.
translations.idiomatic: King Helu of Wu's younger brother Fu wanted to battle, but Helu did not permit it.

sentences.zh: 夫曰：「王已屬臣兵，兵以利為上，尚何待焉？」

translations.literal: Fu said: 'King already entrusted minister troops, troops with advantage as supreme, still what wait for?'
translations.idiomatic: Fu said: 'The king has already entrusted me with troops. Troops take advantage as supreme. What are we still waiting for?'

sentences.zh: 遂以其部五千人襲冒楚，楚兵大敗，走。

translations.literal: Therefore with his division five thousand attacked surprised Chu, Chu troops greatly defeated, fled.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, with his division of five thousand men, he attacked and surprised Chu. The Chu troops were greatly defeated and fled.

sentences.zh: 於是吳王遂縱兵追之。

translations.literal: Therefore Wu king then unleashed troops pursued them.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the king of Wu then unleashed his troops to pursue them.

sentences.zh: 比至郢，五戰，楚五敗。

translations.literal: By arrived Ying, five battles, Chu five defeats.
translations.idiomatic: By the time they arrived at Ying, there were five battles, and Chu was defeated five times.

sentences.zh: 楚昭王亡出郢，奔鄖。

translations.literal: Chu Zhao Wang fled out Ying, ran to Yun.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhao of Chu fled out of Ying and ran to Yun.

sentences.zh: 鄖公弟欲弒昭王，昭王與鄖公奔隨。

translations.literal: Yun Gong younger brother wanted assassinate Zhao Wang, Zhao Wang with Yun Gong ran to Sui.
translations.idiomatic: The younger brother of the Duke of Yun wanted to assassinate King Zhao, so King Zhao and the Duke of Yun ran to Sui.

sentences.zh: 而吳兵遂入郢。

translations.literal: And Wu troops then entered Ying.
translations.idiomatic: And the Wu troops then entered Ying.

sentences.zh: 子胥、伯嚭鞭平王之尸以報父讎。

translations.literal: Zixu, Bo Pi whipped Ping Wang corpse to avenge father enmity.
translations.idiomatic: Zixu and Bo Pi whipped the corpse of King Ping to avenge their father's enmity.

translations.literal: Ninth year, Wu King He Lu asked Wu Zi Xu, Sun Wu: 'At first your words Ying not enterable, now indeed how?' Two sons answered: 'Chu general Zi Chang greedy, Tang, Cai all resent him. King must wish great attack, must obtain Tang, Cai then possible.' He Lu followed it, completely raised troops, with Tang, Cai west attacked Chu, reached Han River. Chu also sent troops resisted Wu, flanked river arrayed. Wu King He Lu younger brother Fu wished battle, He Lu not permitted. Fu said: 'King already entrusted me troops, troops with benefit as highest, moreover wait what?' Then with his division five thousand attacked across Chu, Chu troops greatly defeated, fled. Therefore Wu king then released troops pursued them. When reached Ying, five battles, Chu five defeats. Chu Zhao Wang fled out Ying, ran to Yun. Yun Gong's younger brother wished assassinate Zhao Wang, Zhao Wang with Yun Gong fled to Sui. Wu troops then entered Ying. Zi Xu, Bo Pi whipped Ping Wang's corpse to report father enmity.

sentences.zh: 十年春，越聞吳王之在郢，國空，乃伐吳。

translations.literal: Tenth year spring, Yue heard Wu king at Ying, state empty, then attacked Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In the spring of the tenth year, Yue heard that the king of Wu was at Ying and the state was empty, so they attacked Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳使別兵擊越。

translations.literal: Wu sent separate troops attacked Yue.
translations.idiomatic: Wu sent separate troops to attack Yue.

sentences.zh: 楚告急秦，秦遣兵救楚擊吳，吳師敗。

translations.literal: Chu urgently reported Qin, Qin sent troops saved Chu attacked Wu, Wu troops defeated.
translations.idiomatic: Chu urgently reported to Qin, and Qin sent troops to save Chu and attack Wu. The Wu troops were defeated.

sentences.zh: 闔廬弟夫見秦越交敗吳，吳王留楚不去，夫亡歸吳而自立為吳王。

translations.literal: Helu younger brother Fu saw Qin Yue mutually defeated Wu, Wu king stayed Chu not left, Fu fled returned Wu and self-established as Wu king.
translations.idiomatic: Helu's younger brother Fu saw that Qin and Yue had mutually defeated Wu, and the king of Wu stayed in Chu and did not leave. Fu fled, returned to Wu, and established himself as the king of Wu.

sentences.zh: 闔廬聞之，乃引兵歸，攻夫。

translations.literal: Helu heard this, then led troops returned, attacked Fu.
translations.idiomatic: Helu heard of this, then led his troops back and attacked Fu.

sentences.zh: 夫敗奔楚。

translations.literal: Fu defeated fled Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Fu was defeated and fled to Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚昭王乃得以九月復入郢，而封夫槩於堂谿，為堂谿氏。

translations.literal: Chu Zhao Wang then able ninth month again entered Ying, and enfeoffed Fu Gai at Tang Xi, made Tang Xi clan.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhao of Chu was then able to enter Ying again in the ninth month, and he enfeoffed Fu Gai at Tang Xi, making him the Tang Xi clan.

sentences.zh: 十一年，吳王使太子夫差伐楚，取番。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Wu king sent crown prince Fu Chai attacked Chu, took Fan.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, the king of Wu sent the crown prince Fu Chai to attack Chu and took Fan.

sentences.zh: 楚恐而去郢徙鄀。

translations.literal: Chu feared and left Ying moved to Rui.
translations.idiomatic: Chu was afraid and left Ying, moving to Rui.

translations.literal: Tenth year spring, Yue heard Wu king's in Ying, country empty, then attacked Wu. Wu sent separate troops attacked Yue. Chu urgently told Qin, Qin sent troops saved Chu attacked Wu, Wu troops defeated. He Lu's younger brother Fu saw Qin Yue mutually defeated Wu, Wu king stayed Chu not leave, Fu fled returned Wu self established as Wu king. He Lu heard it, then led troops returned, attacked Fu. Fu defeated fled Chu. Chu Zhao Wang then able ninth month re-entered Ying, enfeoffed Fu Gai at Tang Xi, became Tang Xi Shi. Eleventh year, Wu king sent crown prince Fu Cha attacked Chu, took Fan. Chu feared left Ying moved to Dui.

sentences.zh: 十五年，孔子相魯。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, Confucius assisted Lu.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, Confucius assisted Lu.

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, Confucius chancellor Lu.

sentences.zh: 十九年夏，吳伐越，越王句踐迎擊之檇李。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year summer, Wu attacked Yue, Yue king Gou Jian met attacked them at Gui Li.
translations.idiomatic: In the summer of the nineteenth year, Wu attacked Yue, and King Gou Jian of Yue met and attacked them at Gui Li.

sentences.zh: 越使死士挑戰，三行造吳師，呼，自剄。

translations.literal: Yue sent death soldiers provoked battle, three rows approached Wu troops, called out, self slit throats.
translations.idiomatic: Yue sent death soldiers to provoke battle. Three rows approached the Wu troops, called out, and slit their own throats.

sentences.zh: 吳師觀之，越因伐吳，敗之姑蘇，傷吳王闔廬指，軍卻七里。

translations.literal: Wu troops watched them, Yue therefore attacked Wu, defeated them Gu Su, wounded Wu king Helu finger, army retreated seven li.
translations.idiomatic: The Wu troops watched them, and Yue therefore attacked Wu. They defeated them at Gu Su, wounded King Helu of Wu's finger, and the army retreated seven li.

sentences.zh: 吳王病傷而死。

translations.literal: Wu king died from wound illness.
translations.idiomatic: The king of Wu died from the wound and illness.

sentences.zh: 闔廬使立太子夫差，謂曰：「爾而忘句踐殺汝父乎？」

translations.literal: Helu made establish crown prince Fu Chai, told him: 'You will forget Gou Jian killed your father?'
translations.idiomatic: Helu made the crown prince Fu Chai be established and told him: 'Will you forget that Gou Jian killed your father?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「不敢！」

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Not dare!'
translations.idiomatic: He replied and said: 'I do not dare to forget!'

sentences.zh: 三年，乃報越。

translations.literal: Third year, then avenged Yue.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, he then avenged Yue.

translations.literal: Nineteenth year summer, Wu attacked Yue, Yue king Gou Jian welcomed attacked at Qian Li. Yue sent dead soldiers challenged, three rows approached Wu troops, called, self beheaded. Wu troops observed it, Yue then attacked Wu, defeated at Gusu, injured Wu king He Lu finger, army retreated seven li. Wu king ill injured died. He Lu made establish crown prince Fu Cha, told: 'You forget Gou Jian killed your father?' Answered: 'Dare not!' Three years, then avenged Yue.

sentences.zh: 王夫差元年，以大夫伯嚭為太宰。

translations.literal: King Fu Chai first year, with grand master Bo Pi as prime minister.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of King Fu Chai, he made the grand master Bo Pi the prime minister.

sentences.zh: 習戰射，常以報越為志。

translations.literal: Practiced battle archery, often with avenging Yue as ambition.
translations.idiomatic: He practiced battle and archery, often with avenging Yue as his ambition.

sentences.zh: 二年，吳王悉精兵以伐越，敗之夫椒，報姑蘇也。

translations.literal: Second year, Wu king all elite troops attacked Yue, defeated them Fu Jiao, avenged Gu Su also.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, the king of Wu used all his elite troops to attack Yue. He defeated them at Fu Jiao, avenging Gu Su.

sentences.zh: 越王句踐乃以甲兵五千人棲於會稽，使大夫種因吳太宰嚭而行成，請委國為臣妾。

translations.literal: Yue king Gou Jian then with armored troops five thousand perched at Kui Ji, sent grand master Zhong through Wu prime minister Pi to negotiate peace, requested entrusted state as servants.
translations.idiomatic: King Gou Jian of Yue then with five thousand armored troops perched at Kui Ji. He sent the grand master Zhong through Wu's prime minister Pi to negotiate peace and requested to entrust the state as servants.

sentences.zh: 吳王將許之，伍子胥諫曰：「昔有過氏殺斟灌以伐斟尋，滅夏后帝相。

translations.literal: Wu king about to permit it, Wu Zixu advised: 'Formerly You Guo clan killed Zhen Guan to attack Zhen Xun, extinguished Xia Hou Di Xiang.'
translations.idiomatic: The king of Wu was about to permit it, but Wu Zixu advised: 'Formerly, the You Guo clan killed Zhen Guan to attack Zhen Xun and extinguished Emperor Xiang of the Xia Hou.

sentences.zh: 帝相之妃后緡方娠，逃於有仍而生少康。

translations.literal: Di Xiang consort Hou Zhen just pregnant, fled to You Ren and gave birth Shao Kang.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Xiang's consort Hou Zhen was just pregnant, fled to the state of You Ren, and gave birth to Shao Kang.

sentences.zh: 少康為有仍牧正。

translations.literal: Shao Kang was You Ren herder chief.
translations.idiomatic: Shao Kang was the herder chief of You Ren.

sentences.zh: 有過又欲殺少康，少康奔有虞。

translations.literal: You Guo again wanted kill Shao Kang, Shao Kang fled You Yu.
translations.idiomatic: You Guo again wanted to kill Shao Kang, so Shao Kang fled to You Yu.

sentences.zh: 有虞思夏德，於是妻之以二女而邑之於綸，有田一成，有眾一旅。

translations.literal: You Yu thought Xia virtue, therefore gave him two daughters and enfeoffed him at Lun, had fields one cheng, had followers one lu.
translations.idiomatic: You Yu thought of the virtue of the Xia, and therefore gave him two daughters as wives and enfeoffed him at Lun. He had fields of one cheng and followers of one lu.

sentences.zh: 後遂收夏眾，撫其官職。

translations.literal: Later then gathered Xia masses, pacified their official positions.
translations.idiomatic: Later, he then gathered the Xia masses and pacified their official positions.

sentences.zh: 使人誘之，遂滅有過氏，復禹之績，祀夏配天，不失舊物。

translations.literal: Sent people lured them, then extinguished You Guo clan, restored Yu merit, sacrificed Xia matched heaven, not lost old things.
translations.idiomatic: He sent people to lure them, then extinguished the You Guo clan, restored Yu's merit, sacrificed to Xia and matched heaven, and did not lose the old things.

sentences.zh: 今吳不如有過之彊，而句踐大於少康。

translations.literal: Now Wu not equal You Guo strong, and Gou Jian greater than Shao Kang.
translations.idiomatic: Now, the state of Wu is not as strong as You Guo, and Gou Jian is greater than Shao Kang.

sentences.zh: 今不因此而滅之，又將寬之，不亦難乎！

translations.literal: Now not therefore extinguish them, moreover will forgive them, not also difficult!'
translations.idiomatic: Now, if we do not extinguish them because of this, and moreover will forgive them, will it not also be a difficult situation!'

sentences.zh: 且句踐為人能辛苦，今不滅，後必悔之。」

translations.literal: Moreover Gou Jian as person able toil hardship, now not extinguish, later must regret it.'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, Gou Jian as a person is able to toil through hardship. If we do not extinguish them now, we will later regret it.'

sentences.zh: 吳王不聽，聽太宰嚭，卒許越平，與盟而罷兵去。

translations.literal: Wu king not listened, listened prime minister Pi, finally permitted Yue peace, with allied and dismissed troops left.
translations.idiomatic: The king of Wu did not listen but listened to the prime minister Pi. He finally permitted Yue peace, made an alliance, dismissed the troops, and left.

translations.literal: King Fu Cha first year, with grand master Bo Pi as chief steward. Practiced battle archery, constantly took avenging Yue as ambition. Second year, Wu king completely elite troops attacked Yue, defeated at Fu Jiao, avenged Gusu. Yue king Gou Jian then with armored troops five thousand perched at Kuaiji, sent grand master Zhong through Wu chief steward Pi to seek peace, requested submit state as servant concubine. Wu king about to permit it, Wu Zi Xu advised: 'Formerly Guo Shi killed Zhen Guan to attack Zhen Xun, extinguished Xia Hou Di Xiang. Di Xiang's consort Hou Fen just pregnant, fled to You Ren gave birth Shao Kang. Shao Kang became You Ren's shepherd chief. Guo Shi again wished kill Shao Kang, Shao Kang fled You Yu. You Yu thought Xia virtue, then married two daughters gave city at Lun, had field one cheng, had followers one brigade. Afterward collected Xia multitudes, caressed their official duties. Sent person lured, then extinguished Guo Shi, restored Yu's merit, sacrificed Xia matched heaven, not lost old things. Now Wu not like Guo Shi's strong, Gou Jian greater than Shao Kang. Now not take this extinguish it, moreover will relax it, not also difficult? Moreover Gou Jian as person able endure hardship, now not extinguish, afterward must regret.' Wu king not listen, listened chief steward Pi, finally permitted Yue peace, allied and dismissed troops left.

sentences.zh: 七年，吳王夫差聞齊景公死而大臣爭寵，新君弱，乃興師北伐齊。

translations.literal: Seventh year, Wu king Fu Chai heard Qi Jing Gong died and ministers contended favor, new lord weak, then raised troops north attacked Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, King Fu Chai of Wu heard that Duke Jing of Qi had died and that the ministers were contending for favor, and the new lord was weak. He then raised troops and attacked Qi to the north.

sentences.zh: 子胥諫曰：「越王句踐食不重味，衣不重采，弔死問疾，且欲有所用其眾。

translations.literal: Zixu advised: 'Yue king Gou Jian eat not repeat flavors, wear not repeat colors, condole dead inquire sick, moreover wants to use their masses.'
translations.idiomatic: Zixu advised: 'King Gou Jian of Yue does not eat repeated flavors, does not wear repeated colors, condoles the dead and inquires of the sick. Moreover, he wants to use his masses.

sentences.zh: 此人不死，必為吳患。

translations.literal: This person not die, must become Wu calamity.
translations.idiomatic: If this person does not die, he will certainly become a calamity for Wu.

sentences.zh: 今越在腹心疾而王不先，而務齊，不亦謬乎！」

translations.literal: Now Yue in heart abdomen illness and king not first, and attends Qi, not also mistaken!'
translations.idiomatic: Now, Yue is an illness in the heart and abdomen, and the king does not attend to it first, but attends to Qi. Is this not also mistaken!'

sentences.zh: 吳王不聽，遂北伐齊，敗齊師於艾陵。

translations.literal: Wu king not listened, then north attacked Qi, defeated Qi troops at Ai Ling.
translations.idiomatic: The king of Wu did not listen, then attacked Qi to the north and defeated the Qi troops at Ai Ling.

sentences.zh: 至繒，召魯哀公而徵百牢。

translations.literal: Arrived Zeng, summoned Lu Ai Gong and exacted one hundred sets of sacrificial animals.
translations.idiomatic: He arrived at Zeng, summoned Duke Ai of Lu, and exacted one hundred sets of sacrificial animals.

sentences.zh: 季康子使子貢以周禮說太宰嚭，乃得止。

translations.literal: Ji Kang Zi sent Zi Gong with Zhou rites persuaded prime minister Pi, then got to stop.
translations.idiomatic: Jikangzi sent Zigong to persuade the prime minister Pi with Zhou rites, and then they got to stop.

sentences.zh: 因留略地於齊魯之南。

translations.literal: Therefore stayed and raided lands south of Qi and Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, he stayed and raided lands to the south of Qi and Lu.

sentences.zh: 九年，為騶伐魯，至與魯盟乃去。

translations.literal: Ninth year, for Zou attacked Lu, arrived and allied with Lu then left.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, for Zou, he attacked Lu, arrived and made an alliance with Lu, then left.

sentences.zh: 十年，因伐齊而歸。

translations.literal: Tenth year, because attacked Qi and returned.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, because he attacked Qi, he returned.

sentences.zh: 十一年，復北伐齊。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, again north attacked Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, he again attacked Qi to the north.

translations.literal: Seventh year, Wu king Fu Cha heard Qi Jing Gong died ministers contended favor, new lord weak, then raised troops north attacked Qi. Zi Xu advised: 'Yue king Gou Jian eats not repeated flavors, wears not repeated colors, mourns dead asks ill, moreover wishes use his multitudes. This person not die, must become Wu trouble. Now Yue in heart disease but king not first, but attends Qi, not also mistaken?' Wu king not listen, then north attacked Qi, defeated Qi troops at Ai Ling. Reached Zeng, summoned Lu Ai Gong demanded hundred tribute offerings. Ji Kang Zi made Zi Gong with Zhou rites persuade chief steward Pi, then able stop. Because stayed seized land at Qi Lu south. Ninth year, for Zou attacked Lu, to allied with Lu then left. Tenth year, took advantage attacked Qi returned. Eleventh year, again north attacked Qi.

sentences.zh: 越王句踐率其眾以朝吳，厚獻遺之，吳王喜。

translations.literal: Yue king Gou Jian led his masses to court Wu, thickly presented gifts to them, Wu king happy.
translations.idiomatic: King Gou Jian of Yue led his masses to court Wu and thickly presented gifts to them. The king of Wu was happy.

sentences.zh: 唯子胥懼，曰：「是棄吳也。」

translations.literal: Only Zixu feared, said: 'This is abandoning Wu also.'
translations.idiomatic: Only Zixu was afraid and said: 'This is abandoning Wu.'

sentences.zh: 諫曰：「越在腹心，今得志於齊，猶石田，無所用。

translations.literal: Advised: 'Yue in heart abdomen, now achieved ambition in Qi, like stone fields, nothing use.'
translations.idiomatic: He advised: 'Yue is in the heart and abdomen. Now that we have achieved our ambition in Qi, it is like stone fields, of no use.

sentences.zh: 且盤庚之誥有顛越勿遺，商之以興。」

translations.literal: Moreover Pan Geng announcement has overturn Yue not abandon, Shang thereby rose.'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, Pan Geng's announcement has 'overturn Yue, do not abandon,' and the state of Shang thereby rose.'

sentences.zh: 吳王不聽，使子胥於齊，子胥屬其子於齊鮑氏，還報吳王。

translations.literal: Wu king not listened, sent Zixu to Qi, Zixu entrusted his son to Qi Bao clan, returned reported Wu king.
translations.idiomatic: The king of Wu did not listen and sent Zixu to Qi. Zixu entrusted his son to the Bao clan of Qi, returned, and reported to the king of Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳王聞之，大怒，賜子胥屬鏤之劍以死。

translations.literal: Wu king heard this, greatly angered, granted Zixu the Lou sword to die.
translations.idiomatic: The king of Wu heard of this, was greatly angered, and granted Zixu the Zhulou sword to die.

sentences.zh: 將死，曰：「樹吾墓上以梓，令可為器。
